Adas.description: Adas (Fennel) is a fragrant herb traditionally used to soothe the digestive system. It is effective for relieving stomach discomfort and improving appetite.

Aloevera.description: A succulent medicinal plant known for its soothing gel. It is widely used for skin repair, cooling burns, and supporting internal digestive health.

Amla.description: A nutrient-rich fruit exceptionally high in Vitamin C. It is a powerful rejuvenator that supports immunity, hair strength, and digestive vitality.

Amruta_Balli.description: A versatile climbing shrub in Ayurveda. It is primarily used for managing fevers, boosting natural immunity, and supporting healthy blood sugar levels.

Andong Merah.description: A traditional medicinal plant with vibrant leaves. It is valued for its ability to purify blood and support the healing of external and internal inflammations.

Arali.description: An ornamental plant with traditional medicinal applications. Used externally in controlled traditional practices for skin-related inflammations.

Ashoka.description: A sacred tree in traditional medicine, particularly valued for women's health. It helps in balancing hormones and relieving stress.

Ashwagandha.description: A premier adaptogenic herb that helps the body manage stress. It is widely used to improve sleep quality and combat physical and mental exhaustion.

Avacado.description: A nutrient-dense fruit rich in healthy monounsaturated fats. It supports cardiovascular health and provides essential nourishment for dry skin and hair.

Bamboo.description: Rich in natural silica, bamboo extracts are used to strengthen connective tissues. It supports bone density and helps reduce bodily inflammation.

Basale.description: A succulent leafy vegetable that acts as a natural coolant. It is excellent for soothing digestive irritation and relieving mild constipation.

Belimbing Wulu.description: A sour medicinal fruit known for its high acidity and vitamin content. It is traditionally used to improve digestion and support immune function.

Beluntas.description: A hardy shrub used in traditional herbal drinks. It is specifically known for its ability to reduce body odor and support digestive health.

Betadin.description: Commonly known as the 'iodine plant' due to its potent antiseptic sap. It is used as a first-aid remedy for cleaning and healing minor cuts.

Betel.description: The betel leaf is a traditional digestive stimulant and oral freshener. It possesses antimicrobial properties that support gum health and respiratory relief.

Betel_Nut.description: Traditionally used in small quantities as a digestive stimulant. It is known for its astringent properties that support intestinal health.

Brahmi.description: A renowned nerve tonic and cognitive enhancer. It helps in improving focus, reducing anxiety, and supporting memory retention.

Castor.description: The source of castor oil, a powerful natural laxative. It is also used topically to relieve joint stiffness and soothe very dry skin.

Cincau Perdu.description: A plant used to make traditional grass jelly. It has significant cooling properties that help soothe gastric heat and prevent dehydration.

Curry_Leaf.description: An essential culinary herb with deep medicinal roots. It supports healthy blood sugar levels and is a traditional remedy for hair and digestive health.

Daun Afrika.description: A bitter-tasting medicinal leaf known for its strong detoxifying properties. It supports the immune system and helps in blood purification.

Daun Cabe Jawa.description: A species of long pepper used to stimulate appetite and improve digestion. It has warming properties that help relieve digestive cramps.

Daun Cocor Bebek.description: Known as the 'miracle leaf,' it is widely used for its incredible skin-healing properties, especially for minor burns and inflammations.

Daun Kumis Kucing.description: Commonly known as 'Cat's Whiskers,' this plant is a powerful natural diuretic that supports kidney and urinary tract health.

Daun Mangkokan.description: A traditional remedy for scalp health. The leaves are used to strengthen hair roots and soothe various skin inflammations.

Daun Suji.description: Beyond its use as a natural food colorant, Suji leaves are traditionally used to stimulate appetite and support general digestive function.

Daun Ungu.description: A well-known traditional remedy for hemorrhoids. It has anti-inflammatory properties that help reduce swelling and digestive discomfort.

Dewa Ndaru.description: A plant rich in antioxidants that helps the body recover from fatigue. It supports the immune system and helps manage daily stress.

Doddapatre.description: Also known as Indian Borage, it is a go-to remedy for respiratory issues like cold and cough, as well as soothing digestive cramps.

Ekka.description: A plant used in traditional medicine for its potent anti-inflammatory properties. It is often applied externally to relieve joint and muscle pain.

Gandarusa.description: A medicinal shrub primarily used for managing bone and joint-related issues. It helps reduce stiffness and improve mobility in joints.

Ganike.description: Commonly known as Black Nightshade, it is used in traditional medicine to support digestive health and combat physical fatigue.

Garut.description: Arrowroot is a highly digestible starch source. It is excellent for people with sensitive stomachs and helps in recovering from low energy levels.

Gauva.description: Guava leaves are a powerful traditional remedy for digestive upsets like diarrhea. They are also rich in Vitamin C for immune support.

Geranium.description: Known for its pleasant scent and skin-soothing properties. It is often used to manage skin inflammation and reduce symptoms of mild anxiety.

Henna.description: A natural coolant for the body. Henna is widely used to treat scalp issues like dandruff and provide relief from minor skin irritations or burns.

Hibiscus.description: A flowering plant renowned for hair care. It helps prevent premature greying and is used to support healthy blood pressure levels.

Honge.description: Commonly known as Karanja, its oil and extracts are potent remedies for chronic skin diseases and support effective wound healing.

Honje.description: Torch Ginger is valued for its unique antioxidant profile. It supports digestive health and provides a refreshing boost to the body's natural defenses.

Iler.description: An ornamental plant with significant medicinal value for skin health. It is used to accelerate the healing of minor wounds and skin inflammations.

Insulin.description: Specifically used for managing metabolic health. It is traditionally believed to help regulate blood sugar levels and improve insulin sensitivity.

Jahe.description: Ginger is a world-renowned remedy for digestive health. It is highly effective against nausea, motion sickness, and the common cold.

Jasmine.description: The fragrance of jasmine has profound effects on the nervous system. It is used in traditional medicine to relieve stress and support restful sleep.

Jeruk Nipis.description: Lime is a powerhouse of Vitamin C and citric acid. It supports immune function, aids in detoxification, and helps balance digestive acidity.

Kapulaga.description: Cardamom is a premium digestive spice. It helps in relieving nausea, improving appetite, and naturally freshening the breath.

Kayu Putih.description: The source of Cajuput oil, which is used for its warming and clearing effects on the respiratory system and sore muscles.

Kecibling.description: A traditional herb used to support urinary health. It is believed to help maintain healthy kidney function and clear urinary tracts.

Kemangi.description: Lemon Basil is used to soothe the digestive system and manage daily stress. It also possesses mild natural antibacterial properties.

Kembang Sepatu.description: Similar to Hibiscus, these flowers are used for hair nourishment and supporting healthy circulation and blood pressure.

Kenanga.description: Ylang-Ylang is famous for its calming essential oil. It is used to reduce anxiety, manage stress, and support those with sleep disorders.

Kunyit.description: Turmeric is a potent anti-inflammatory and antioxidant. It is widely used for joint health, digestive support, and healing wounds.

Lampes.description: A relative of Holy Basil, it is used to combat physical fatigue and support the digestive system during periods of weakness.

Legundi.description: A traditional remedy for respiratory conditions. It is particularly valued for its ability to soothe coughs and manage symptoms of asthma.

Lemon.description: Rich in essential nutrients, lemon is used to boost immunity and revitalize dull skin through its detoxifying properties.

Lemon_grass.description: A refreshing grass used to manage mild fevers and digestive bloating. Its aroma is also highly effective for stress relief.

Lidah Buaya.description: A widely recognized healing plant for skin and digestion. It provides immediate relief for minor burns and helps manage constipation.

Mahkota Dewa.description: A potent medicinal plant from Indonesia used for purifying the blood and managing various metabolic and inflammatory conditions.

Mango.description: Mango leaves and fruits provide essential nutrients that support digestive function and overall nutritional balance.

Melati.description: Jasmine flowers are used topically to soothe minor skin irritations and aromatically to reduce daily stress and anxiety.

Meniran.description: A small herb with significant power to support liver health. It is a traditional remedy for jaundice and immune system weakness.

Mint.description: Mint is an excellent remedy for various digestive complaints, including acidity and nausea. It also provides relief from tension headaches.

Murbey.description: Mulberry leaves are used to support healthy blood sugar levels and provide strong antioxidant support for the entire body.

Nagadali.description: Commonly known as Rue, it is used in traditional medicine to manage physical fatigue and soothe mild digestive discomfort.

Neem.description: A cornerstone of herbal medicine, Neem is a powerful antiseptic. It is used for acne, skin infections, and supporting healthy blood sugar.

Nilam.description: Patchouli is known for its skin-healing properties, particularly for fungal issues and inflammation, as well as its grounding aroma.

Nithyapushpa.description: Periwinkle is traditionally used to manage physical fatigue and help the body adapt to mental stress.

Nooni.description: Noni is a tropical fruit known for its comprehensive immune-boosting and digestive-supporting properties.

Pacing Petul.description: Used in traditional medicine to manage bodily inflammations and provide relief from persistent joint pain.

Pandan.description: A fragrant plant that supports digestive health and is traditionally used to improve a lagging appetite.

Pappaya.description: Papaya is famous for its digestive enzymes. It is an effective remedy for constipation and maintaining a healthy gut environment.

Patah Tulang.description: Traditionally used to support the healing of bones and joints. It has strong anti-inflammatory properties for external use.

Pecut Kuda.description: A traditional remedy for relieving muscle pain and physical exhaustion after strenuous activity.

Pepper.description: Black pepper is a warming spice that stimulates digestion and helps clear respiratory congestion during a cold.

Pomegranate.description: A superfood fruit that supports heart health and blood quality. It is excellent for managing fatigue and anemia.

Raktachandini.description: Red Sandalwood is prized for its skin-healing properties. It is used to manage skin diseases and support blood purification.

Rose.description: Rose extracts are cooling and soothing. They are traditionally used to manage skin inflammation and provide relief from stress and anxiety.

Saga Manis.description: Traditionally used in small, processed amounts to soothe the throat and manage symptoms of throat irritation or cough.

Sapota.description: Chikoo is a high-energy fruit that supports digestive health and provides relief from physical fatigue.

Secang.description: Sappan wood is used to make a traditional medicinal drink that purifies the blood and helps reduce fever and inflammation.

Sereh.description: Another variety of Lemongrass used to soothe digestive bloating, manage fever, and reduce stress.

Sirih.description: Similar to Betel, it is used for maintaining oral hygiene, relieving bad breath, and soothing coughs.

Srikaya.description: Sugar Apple provides essential nutrients and antioxidants that support healthy digestion and overall vitality.

Tin.description: Figs are a premier source of dietary fiber. They are excellent for managing constipation and soothing digestive irritation.

Tulasi.description: Holy Basil is a 'queen of herbs.' It is highly effective for respiratory health issues like cold, cough, and asthma, while boosting immunity.

Wood_sorel.description: A cooling plant used to manage acidity and soothe digestive irritation.

Zigzag.description: An ornamental plant used in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory properties and stress relief.
